titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an George Edward Moore, [19. 3. 1936]
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Original bei Timothy Moore; Kopie im BA. Publiziert (Letters, S. 164; deutsch: Briefe, S. 196; Cambridge Letters, S. 274).

list.item: 2007/06: Conversion from Folio Flat File to XML

div.p: The Thomsons want you & me to come to them tomorrow at teatime. (They live: Lavender Cottage, Storey's Way off Huntingdon Rd.) Now I don't feel very well, I may have a slight 'flue or something, so I probably shan't be able to come. But they should like to see you without me, & possibly you might play some piano-duetts with Mrs Thomson. So would you go there say at 4.15 or if you can't, write them a note?
I wish I could be there & hear you play!
